nonCompete.detailedExplanation: Wyoming enforces reasonable non-compete agreements. Must protect legitimate business interest with reasonable time, geography, and scope limitations. Courts will assess reasonableness on case-by-case basis. Typically 1-2 years considered reasonable.
nonCompete.suggestion: Keep duration to 1-2 years, reasonable geographic scope
nonCompete.alternativeLanguage: reasonable non-compete restrictions protecting legitimate business interests

salaryHistory.detailedExplanation: Wyoming has no law restricting salary history questions

payTransparency.detailedExplanation: No requirement to disclose salary ranges in job postings

backgroundChecks.message: Background checks permitted at any stage
backgroundChecks.detailedExplanation: No ban-the-box law. Criminal history can be inquired about on applications. Must comply with federal FCRA.

minimumWage.detailedExplanation: Wyoming state minimum wage is $5.15/hour, but federal minimum of $7.25/hour applies to most employers under FLSA.
minimumWage.requirement: Must pay federal minimum wage of $7.25/hour
minimumWage.actionRequired: Ensure compliance with federal minimum wage

paidLeave.detailedExplanation: Wyoming does not require paid sick leave, paid family leave, or vacation time

drugScreening.detailedExplanation: Wyoming allows pre-employment, random, reasonable suspicion, and post-accident drug testing with no specific restrictions.
drugScreening.suggestion: Drug testing is legal and unrestricted

atWill.detailedExplanation: Wyoming is a strong at-will employment state. Employment is presumed at-will with very limited exceptions.
atWill.bestPractice: Include clear at-will disclaimer for maximum protection
atWill.suggestion: Strong at-will language is recommended and legally protective

arbitration.detailedExplanation: Wyoming follows FAA. Arbitration clauses generally enforceable.

finalPay.message: Final wages due within 5 working days or next regular payday
finalPay.detailedExplanation: Discharged employees: within 5 working days of discharge. Resigned employees: next regular payday or 15 days, whichever is shorter.
finalPay.requirement: Pay within 5 working days if terminated
finalPay.actionRequired: Ensure 5-day final payment capability for terminations

rightToWork.message: Wyoming is a RIGHT TO WORK state
rightToWork.detailedExplanation: Union membership and dues payment cannot be required as condition of employment
rightToWork.actionRequired: Cannot require union membership or dues

breaks.message: NO required meal or rest breaks for adults
breaks.detailedExplanation: Wyoming does not mandate meal or rest breaks for adult employees. Federal law requires breaks under 20 minutes be paid if provided.
breaks.bestPractice: Consider providing breaks for employee wellbeing

payFrequency.message: Must pay employees at least semi-monthly
payFrequency.detailedExplanation: Wages must be paid at least semi-monthly (twice per month) on regular paydays. Employers must designate regular paydays.
payFrequency.requirement: Pay at least semi-monthly (twice per month)
payFrequency.actionRequired: Establish and communicate semi-monthly or more frequent pay schedule
